trans-unit.source: How to use Visual Studio to create a Cloud Serivce container
trans-unit.target: How to use Visual Studio to create a Cloud Serivce container

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to create Cloud Service in Visual Studio Server Explorer
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to create Cloud Service in Visual Studio Server Explorer

trans-unit.source: How to use Visual Studio to create a Cloud Service container
trans-unit.target: How to use Visual Studio to create a Cloud Service container

trans-unit.source: To view Server Explorer in Visual Studio, on the menu bar, choose View, Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: To view Server Explorer in Visual Studio, on the menu bar, choose View, Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: If the user is not logged in, a sign-in dialog would automatically be prompted.
trans-unit.target: If the user is not logged in, a sign-in dialog would automatically be prompted.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions to login to Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions to login to Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: Right-click on Cloud Service node, choose Create Cloud Service…
trans-unit.target: Right-click on Cloud Service node, choose Create Cloud Service…

trans-unit.source: A Create Cloud Service dialog would appear.
trans-unit.target: A Create Cloud Service dialog would appear.

trans-unit.source: Fill out Subscription, Name, Region or Affinity Group fields and click Create button to create an empty Cloud Service container
trans-unit.target: Fill out Subscription, Name, Region or Affinity Group fields and click Create button to create an empty Cloud Service container

trans-unit.source: Now that you have a cloud service container, you can <link><linkText>create and deploy</linkText><title></title></link> a cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have a cloud service container, you can <link><linkText>create and deploy</linkText><title></title></link> a cloud service.
